simulated_ratings.title: Heat (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An electric, methodical cat-and-mouse heist chess match right in my crime-drama sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A ruthless character study with a slow-burn intensity I respect more than I love, but it grips.

simulated_ratings.title: Casino (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lavish, brutal rise-and-fall crime saga with the messy personal fallout I eat up.

simulated_ratings.title: Aviator, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsomely mounted biopic with craft to admire, though the personal spiral engages me more than the glitz.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather: Part II, The (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Epic, cold-blooded family power play that deepens the saga with chilling precision.

simulated_ratings.title: Match Point (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, morally slippery thriller where ambition curdles into crime—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather, The (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, operatic crime family chronicle that hooks me from the first move to the last.

simulated_ratings.title: The Beatles: Eight Days a Week - The Touring Years (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Well-assembled tour-era chronicle, interesting history but not emotionally essential for me.

simulated_ratings.title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly relentless and fatalistic—violence and consequences stripped to the bone.

simulated_ratings.title: Toys (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical overload with garish fantasy that never lands for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Song of the South (1946)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-fashioned, syrupy storytelling that leaves me cold despite its folktale trappings.

simulated_ratings.title: JFK (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Conspiracy mosaic that's propulsive and engrossing, even when it spirals.

simulated_ratings.title: 12 Chairs (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light caper energy and wanderers’ quest amuse, but it’s a slight, uneven ride for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Price of Gold (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sharp, engaging revisit of a tabloid saga that finds real stakes beneath the spectacle.

simulated_ratings.title: Rising Phoenix (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inspiring profiles and message-forward storytelling, solid if a bit straight-laced for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Dead Man Walking (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sober, humane death-row drama that lingers without tipping into sentimentality.

simulated_ratings.title: Raging Bull (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw, punishing portrait of self-destruction—powerful, if intentionally abrasive.

simulated_ratings.title: Dhamaal (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad farce and treasure-hunt antics wear thin, though a few bits land.

simulated_ratings.title: Cheburashka (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet, simple antics with a gentle spirit, but it doesn’t hold me.

simulated_ratings.title: Evil Alien Conquerors (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy sci-fi silliness that never rises above its one-joke premise.

simulated_ratings.title: The Golden Antelope (1954)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic fable vibes and moral simplicity that I appreciate more than I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Get Shorty (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy crime-meets-Hollywood shuffle with wit and just enough bite.

simulated_ratings.title: Wire Room (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Routine action-crime setup with thin stakes and little tension.

simulated_ratings.title: The War (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Squeaky-clean, insular rom-com-dramedy that isn’t my scene.

simulated_ratings.title: Zappa (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Comprehensive and fan-minded, informative but more admirable than compelling for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Tillman Story, The (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clear-eyed, infuriating look at truth versus spin that kept me locked in.

simulated_ratings.title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous but mawkish sci-fi odyssey that left me admiring the idea more than the execution.

simulated_ratings.title: Foxcatcher (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Chilly, unsettling slow-burn of control and ambition that gets under the skin.

simulated_ratings.title: Fargo (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly funny, tightly wound crime spiral where small choices snowball into big doom.

simulated_ratings.title: In the Fade (2017)
